Title.evidence: We conducted a double‐blind, randomised feasibility trial comparing peri‐operative angiotensin‐2 with noradrenaline.

Trial_Design.evidence: We randomly allocated 60 patients at two centres to a blinded equipotent angiotensin‐2 or noradrenaline infusion.

Intervention.evidence: We randomly allocated 60 patients at two centres to a blinded equipotent angiotensin‐2 or noradrenaline infusion intra‐operatively and for up to 48 h postoperatively.

Objective.evidence: We conducted a double‐blind, randomised feasibility trial comparing peri‐operative angiotensin‐2 with noradrenaline.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary feasibility outcomes included consent rate, protocol adherence, infusion duration, mean arterial pressure maintenance in the target range and major adverse outcomes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: We randomly allocated 60 patients at two centres to a blinded equipotent angiotensin‐2 or noradrenaline infusion.

Blinding.evidence: We conducted a double‐blind, randomised feasibility trial.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomly allocated 60 patients at two centres.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Acute kidney injury occurred in 7 of 28 in the angiotensin‐2 group vs. 12 of 32 patients in the noradrenaline group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Acute kidney injury occurred in 7 of 28 in the angiotensin‐2 group vs. 12 of 32 patients in the noradrenaline group (p = 0.31).

Harms.evidence: One participant had a stroke, one required extracorporeal support and three required renal replacement therapy, all in the noradrenaline group.
